newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks slip below 1,500 points at close.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks slip below 1,500 points at close.

text.p: Pakistani stocks sank below the 1,500-point barrier at Tuesday's close on settlement day selling of blue chips by jobbers, dealers said.
The Karachi 100-share index ended 4.88 points, or 0.32 percent, down at 1,499.66 amid 224 losers and 64 gainers.
The index fell after jobbers sold blue chips and squared their holdings on settlement day, one dealer said.
Cynamid fell 17 rupees to 569, Dawood Hercules 16 to 160, Ciba Geigy 4.75 to 35.25 and Engro 4.0 to 128.
